required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Will Assess Skin Irritation and Sensitization for HP-1050 Patch
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study to Assess Skin Irritation and Sensitization of HP-1050 Transdermal System Compared to XULANE in Healthy Adult Females

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized, evaluator-blinded study to assess skin irritation and skin sensitization of HP-1050 transdermal system (HP-1050) in comparison to XULANE patch in healthy female volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a dual-center, evaluator-blinded, randomized phase 1 study evaluating skin irritation and skin sensitization of HP-1050 transdermal system in comparison to XULANE patch in healthy female volunteers. The study will consist of a 4-week Screening Phase and a Treatment Phase. The Treatment Phase will consist of the following periods: an Induction Period, a Rest Period followed by a Challenge Period and if needed, a Re-Challenge Period.

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate skin irritation after exposure to HP-1050 compared to XULANE®
To evaluate skin sensitization after exposure to HP-1050 compared to XULANE®

arm_group.description: HP-1050 and Xulane will be administered simultaneously.

intervention.description: Both articles, HP-1050 and XULANE patch, will be applied simultaneously on the back of each subject.
